commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Ibdb2ebccfd782ed5e01b7f0c4bfb6294c89232c6

commit_message:
Remove run_tests.sh wrapper

The run_tests.sh mechanism for performing operations
is no longer the preferred approach. It is now better
to just run tox.

To get rid of confusion by having two different ways
to run unit tests, flake8 checks, etc., it's probably
better to just remove the run_tests.sh script completely
and direct folks to use tox instead. This way we are all
consistent and there is less concern that changes will
be made to one and not the other.

Change-Id: I17af7ed0e5c1d5649f5ba4418b09fa301245d6fc

commit_message:
Adding pagination to snapshots and backups lists

Snapshot and backups pagination was recently implemented in the Cinder
backend. This patch is implementing a pagination for the snapshots and
backups on the client side in the same way that volume pagination works
using limit, marker and sort parameters.

Partial-Implements: blueprint extend-limit-implementations
Change-Id: Ie3660854407a947f7470b4dc0911704c0a31c1b4

subject: WIP: Fix format inconsistencies in the way swift server returns error responses
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-20 18:08:44.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'test/functional/test_object.py', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/account.py', 'swift/common/constraints.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "WIP: Fix format inconsistencies in the way swift server returns error responses

The error response generation in all the servers inside swift is pretty
much inconsistent. They don't respect the accept header of the request.
In some parts, the accept header isn't passed to the backend server at all.
Some parts, even when the backend server responds with a proper format
response such as JSON, and sets the content-type also accordingly, the proxy
server overwrites it with the standard text/html content-type. Some parts,
we always hard code and return text/plain error response, irrespective of the
content type asked. This patch is a attempt to fix all those incosistencies.
This is a WIP. Need feedback/comments about the direction I'm heading.

Change-Id: Id49342705a72abd6bf810b77838a00ebdf501559
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP: Fix format inconsistencies in the way swift server returns error responses

The error response generation in all the servers inside swift is pretty
much inconsistent. They don't respect the accept header of the request.
In some parts, the accept header isn't passed to the backend server at all.
Some parts, even when the backend server responds with a proper format
response such as JSON, and sets the content-type also accordingly, the proxy
server overwrites it with the standard text/html content-type. Some parts,
we always hard code and return text/plain error response, irrespective of the
content type asked. This patch is a attempt to fix all those incosistencies.
This is a WIP. Need feedback/comments about the direction I'm heading.

Change-Id: Id49342705a72abd6bf810b77838a00ebdf501559

commit_message:
Fixing cluster creation without auto_security_group

If auto_security_group is disabled, but one or more
security groups is provided, cluster can't be created
and fails with yaml RepresenterError exception.

Change-Id: I294237c788c2d14d77f12e1a8d7e0dd60a6638bb

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).
This patch fix the issue in the module magnum/tests/unit/api/.

Change-Id: I947346f36212ad518b68ac31ef83cf594e125153
Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Make sure keystone is up before trying to use it

On some systems, keystone may not be up and running yet when the scripts
try to call it. To fix this race, make the scripts wait for keystone.

Change-Id: I6151cbfa6d16ff50a6d7eb0799e2818751dc175b

commit_message:
Create a routing table manager

The routing table manager maps address scope ids to routing tables.
It uses the rt_tables file specific to each namespace to maintain the
mapping so that id can simply be used as the table name when running
iproute2 commands.  This will be useful when debugging.

Change-Id: Ic3332b0f9fbba2b2a6ae2e0d495145d0a1ae1be0

subject: Modularizing Neutron playbooks for master
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 15:27:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Modularizing Neutron playbooks for master

Adding modularization for neutron setup for master.

- Core Plugin can be selected by name, and new ones added to the
  'plugins_neutron' data structure
- Agents are enabled/disabled through 'services_neutron' dict
  in roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml
- Upstart tasks for agentss are run based on individual enabled status
- Agent service names propagate to appropiate handler

Note: The current implementation can be further optimized when
      we move to ansible-v2. The neutron_upstart_init.yml can be
      reduced to a single task that loops on the neutron_services
      dict.

Implements: blueprint modularize-neutron-liberty

(cherry picked from commit ac4f224195251bceaed1fb83bde45b311571f99b)", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Modularizing Neutron playbooks for master

Adding modularization for neutron setup for master.

- Core Plugin can be selected by name, and new ones added to the
  'plugins_neutron' data structure
- Agents are enabled/disabled through 'services_neutron' dict
  in roles/os_neutron/defaults/main.yml
- Upstart tasks for agentss are run based on individual enabled status
- Agent service names propagate to appropiate handler

Note: The current implementation can be further optimized when
      we move to ansible-v2. The neutron_upstart_init.yml can be
      reduced to a single task that loops on the neutron_services
      dict.

Implements: blueprint modularize-neutron-liberty

Change-Id: I9f6a5edbec79d46e2a69cb60366a8af5a4d6a7a0
Signed-off-by: Javeria Khan <javeriak@plumgrid.com>
(cherry picked from commit ac4f224195251bceaed1fb83bde45b311571f99b)

commit_message:
API Quick Start Translations

Setup Japanese API Quick Start for building and checking.
Markup German not anymore as draft.

Do not publish content anymore on docs.openstack.org, our
jobs are going to use publishlang-api to publish on
developer.openstack.org instead.

Change-Id: I67d777a6c271fc8dc1ebe3e75b81a09e7c5c3efb

subject: Rework api-site publishing
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 08:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/api-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Rework api-site publishing

Publishing is now only done on developer.openstack.org and not anymore
on docs.openstack.org:
* Remove api-site-tox-doc-publishdocs
* Create new job openstack-api-ref-publish-lang to publish translated
  documents to developer.o.o.
* Remove api-site-tox-doc-publishlang job (published translated
  documents to docs.o.o). For this, we need to replace the
  openstack-doc-translation template with individual jobs.

Change-Id: Id9d9c378c29e5601fe994b46ede19ddae61cfb53
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rework api-site publishing

Publishing is now only done on developer.openstack.org and not anymore
on docs.openstack.org:
* Remove api-site-tox-doc-publishdocs
* Create new job openstack-api-ref-publish-lang to publish translated
  documents to developer.o.o.
* Remove api-site-tox-doc-publishlang job (published translated
  documents to docs.o.o). For this, we need to replace the
  openstack-doc-translation template with individual jobs.

Change-Id: Id9d9c378c29e5601fe994b46ede19ddae61cfb53

commit_message:
Remove old files used for enabling murano in Devstack

As we are using new plugin model for enabling murano
in devstack, the files in the path "/contrib/devstack/
extras.d/" and "/contrib/devstack/lib/" had not been
using now. So they can be removed which might be
confusing the user.

Implements blueprint outdated-devstack-murano-files
Change-Id: I12ee36743f98fdd50d42bd8c2f5d3b9d132bd4c8

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-10 08:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/virtualbox-install_base.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/functions.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/wbatch/batch_for_windows.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/functions-host.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/virtualbox-functions.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I8249b148b27af577f6b2ca990311f64f339606f7
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I8249b148b27af577f6b2ca990311f64f339606f7
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Don't run gate-python-glanceclient-python34 on stable/juno

python-glanceclient didn't support python 3.4 in Juno so the job fails
hard, let's exclude it from stable/juno.

This is blocking Ie6547d1a5501f2d2ec74d3ec4808c26a48ffc7fb.

Change-Id: I7d84cc0d35021bc70fb9745d9300ffdc1ce63bfb

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-01 21:05:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Baymodel create should allow no network_driver specified

When a kubernetes baymodel is created, the current API validation
only allows an explicit setting of "flannel" for the network-driver
attribute. This validation needs to be changed to allow a user to
create a kubernetes baymodel without explicitly specifying a
network driver. (The same goes for docker swarm and mesos baymodels,
that is, baymodel create should allow the user not to specify
a network-driver, but this is the current behavior).

When no network-driver is selected for baymodel create for a
given COE, Magnum should choose the default network driver for that
COE. Note that this change set only handles the validation for
the case where no network-driver is selected; mapping this to
the COE-dependent default network driver will be done in other
commits (e.g. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/224367/ for swarm).

Note that no new unit test cases were added for this patch since
test_create_baymodel_with_network_driver and
test_create_baymodel_with_no_network_driver test cases in
test_baymodel.py should cover this change.

Change-Id: I0735f79354bc9fdb141e7a559517268e8ab648ec
Closes-Bug: 1501077

commit_message:
Baymodel create should allow no network_driver specified

When a kubernetes baymodel is created, the current API validation
only allows an explicit setting of "flannel" for the network-driver
attribute. This validation needs to be changed to allow a user to
create a kubernetes baymodel without explicitly specifying a
network driver. (The same goes for docker swarm and mesos baymodels,
that is, baymodel create should allow the user not to specify
a network-driver, but this is the current behavior).

When no network-driver is selected for baymodel create for a
given COE, Magnum should choose the default network driver for that
COE. Note that this change set only handles the validation for
the case where no network-driver is selected; mapping this to
the COE-dependent default network driver will be done in other
commits (e.g. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/224367/ for swarm).

Note that no new unit test cases were added for this patch since
test_create_baymodel_with_network_driver and
test_create_baymodel_with_no_network_driver test cases in
test_baymodel.py should cover this change.

Change-Id: I0735f79354bc9fdb141e7a559517268e8ab648ec
Closes-Bug: 1501077

commit_message:
py3: Replace urllib imports with six.moves.urllib

The urllib, urllib2 and urlparse modules of Python 2 were reorganized
into a new urllib namespace on Python 3. Replace urllib, urllib2 and
urlparse imports with six.moves.urllib to make the modified code
compatible with Python 2 and Python 3.

The initial patch was generated by the urllib operation of the sixer
tool on: bin/* swift/ test/.

Change-Id: I61a8c7fb7972eabc7da8dad3b3d34bceee5c5d93

commit_message:
Change message of log_deprecated decorator

It is unclear what is deprecated in current message.

For example, methods `wait_for`, `wait_is_ready` and `wait_for_delete` were
deprecated in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/232438 . Deprecation
messages are equal, so logs are equal too:

    Deprecated, use wait_for_status instead. (deprecated in Rally v0.1.2)

This patch adds deprecated method's name, so it is easier to determine what
method produces deprecation log message.

Also, this patch adds ability to print warning message once, which can be
helpful for deprecated methods used in scenarios.

Change-Id: Id86e984986ecb61e7b92cc61882382179fc8a74b

commit_message:
Extract random nested level from Cinder scenario

Extract random nested level from create_nested_snapshots_and_attach_volume.
Scenario fail with a big probability. The problem is that in every iteration
scenario creates different number of atomic actions which is not supported
by Rally project. This leads to not proper behavior of Rally reporting.
E.g. it will show that failure rate of some atomic actions is
N% (where N > 0) but overall failure rate is 0%.

Change-Id: Ib1fddfb9fba1cbe64acb8acce3b86cb292bb9b20
Closes-Bug: #1487628

[{'created': '2015-10-02 08:29:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'tox.ini', 'cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Port scheduler host manager to Python 3

* Rewrite ReadOnlyDict using collections.Mapping: collections.Mapping
  has no method to modify the dictionary and is available on Python 2
  and Python 3. Add also a __repr__() method to ease debug. Remove
  ReadOnlyDict.update() method: a read-only dictionary must not be
  modifiable.
* test_host_manager.py: sort dictionaries using a key function to
  have a reliable order for the list of dictionaries. On Python 3,
  the hash function is now randomized.
* tox.ini. add cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/ tests to Python 3.4

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I34d98d6a75fef907251719f0d46b025d8e8b2b65
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Port scheduler host manager to Python 3

* Rewrite ReadOnlyDict using collections.Mapping: collections.Mapping
  has no method to modify the dictionary and is available on Python 2
  and Python 3. Add also a __repr__() method to ease debug. Remove
  ReadOnlyDict.update() method: a read-only dictionary must not be
  modifiable.
* test_host_manager.py: sort dictionaries using a key function to
  have a reliable order for the list of dictionaries. On Python 3,
  the hash function is now randomized.
* tox.ini. add cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/ tests to Python 3.4

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I34d98d6a75fef907251719f0d46b025d8e8b2b65

certification/openstack/scenario/glance.yaml

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-07-03 22:13:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Introduce a simple state machine module

States are used in an ad-hoc fashion all over Nova codebase. It's high
time we added some code that will let us define and abstract basic
operations with state changes.

This commit adds 2 classes that will be used to define the state graph,
and a simple way to step through the state graph. For this we use the
"automaton" library, that is already in uses by several other OpenStack
projects for similar purposes.

Class State is holds a state-space and a name of the state, and a list
of states that we could go from it. Each State instance references 0
or more other states within the same state-space as it's next_states
attribute thus creating a directed graph.

Class FSM represents a state machine, and is a slightly customized
version of the automaton FiniteMachine class that when given a
state-space, builds a graph of all known states and it's transitions,
and also exposes a step() method that will either progress the machine
to a new state or raise an error if the transition is not valid for the
given state-space.

commit_message:
Introduce a simple state machine module

States are used in an ad-hoc fashion all over Nova codebase. It's high
time we added some code that will let us define and abstract basic
operations with state changes.

This commit adds 2 classes that will be used to define the state graph,
and a simple way to step through the state graph. For this we use the
"automaton" library, that is already in uses by several other OpenStack
projects for similar purposes.

Class State is holds a state-space and a name of the state, and a list
of states that we could go from it. Each State instance references 0
or more other states within the same state-space as it's next_states
attribute thus creating a directed graph.

Class FSM represents a state machine, and is a slightly customized
version of the automaton FiniteMachine class that when given a
state-space, builds a graph of all known states and it's transitions,
and also exposes a step() method that will either progress the machine
to a new state or raise an error if the transition is not valid for the
given state-space.

Related-blueprint: migration-fix-resource-tracking
Change-Id: Ic3c9dbd4af8fe92499d84d43ca3e48783f3a59de

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I555bdeba198b1b468884ffce3702f5b06247d573

commit_message:
Remove openstack_deploy from teardown.sh deletion list

This patch prevents teardown.sh script from deleting
/etc/openstack_deploy in order to let the deployer decide whether to
delete it or not.

Change-Id: I8de55c6fce79bd9301d995c565cfb4e0a38b253a
Closes-Bug: #1504561
(cherry picked from commit 6f21ceb86559f9d2c0f0bc765b1602e79cbd10f6)

Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

commit_message:
py34: cleanup

* Tests were skipped due to a mox3 bug. The bug has now been fixed
  and there's a new release of mox3. Unskip it.
* Remove the tool run-py3-tests.sh which isn't needed anymore.

blueprint heat-python34-support

Change-Id: I304d87e4313148c10a2465bf92ae932f525bb4ce

commit_message:
Only get host data for floating ips on DVR routers

First, we are only interested in setting the host attribute when
the router is a DVR router.  Second, we don't need to query all of
the ports on the host, we just need to query the ports that are
referenced by the set of floating ips that we already have.

(cherry picked from commit 3c5cb9d050d09424c3f8eb3cd1ecd6876f50a6fe)

Closes-bug: #1496974
Change-Id: If611de14b2ab77d2eb9ce8c5b307ea6dd4403fe1

commit_message:
Change os-url to os-auth-url on call to OSC

A change was made to the openstackclient that allows the --os-url
switch to be used only when --os-token is used. As we removed the
use of --os-token a while back, we need to switch to using
--os-auth-url instead of --os-url.

Change-Id: Ia769cd4e07e845746adb10d5c25d5095623a8a32
Closes-bug: bug/1504303

subject: Reduce size of CoreOS ramdisk
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 05:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['Dockerfile'], 'message': "Reduce size of CoreOS ramdisk

By disabling pip cache, we're able to reduce the size of generated
docker image by 10%. The resulting ramdisk size goes from 229MB to
218MB.

It is possible to decrease the size even further by combining all the
RUN instructions into one but it doesn't provide a substantial gain and
it harms readability.

Change-Id: Ie23636fe709ab7c1bcf4d6c51299c173a5b642ac
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Reduce size of CoreOS ramdisk

By disabling pip cache, we're able to reduce the size of generated
docker image by 10%. The resulting ramdisk size goes from 229MB to
218MB.

It is possible to decrease the size even further by combining all the
RUN instructions into one but it doesn't provide a substantial gain and
it harms readability.

Change-Id: Ie23636fe709ab7c1bcf4d6c51299c173a5b642ac

commit_message:
Use puppet to configure ironic-inspector

This removes the ironic-inspector element from the
undercloud install, and instead uses the puppet module
to setup the ironic-inspector service.

Depends-On: I9b2917a2c3f6afe75dc295c81d09f7a12856007f
Change-Id: Ic3eca27515721000ed1c9d19a2427276e6b1af68

commit_message:
Switch to use `region_id` for endpoint APIs

`region` field is deprected in favor of `region_id` since keystone v3.2,
please refer to keystone v3 API spec [1].

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/api/v3/identity-api-v3.html#endpoints-v3-endpoints

Change-Id: I5d88449e3b0ac53093eba2d8157a620616d9769c

subject: Remove confusing parameter description in heat API
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-30 04:28:56.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/orchestration-api/src/v1/orchestration-api.wadl'], 'message': 'Remove confusing parameter description in heat API

  At first, Current documentation is correct
  in programatically.
  But it makes confusing for user about "resource_name".
  This patch intends to remove confusing documentation.

  Of course, keep, or add notice for same parameter,
  are another option.

  #Detail#

  Event listing in heat uses common filtering engine.
  And its query parameter is common which includes
  "resouce_name"
  and some REST API uses resource_name in URL.

  its code is here
  heat/api/openstack/v1/events.py

Change-Id: Ie7030fb6ba15b6ee7e66fd3f39c03bed1f736782
Closes-Bug: #1500621
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove confusing parameter description in heat API

  At first, Current documentation is correct
  in programatically.
  But it makes confusing for user about "resource_name".
  This patch intends to remove confusing documentation.

  Of course, keep, or add notice for same parameter,
  are another option.

  #Detail#

  Event listing in heat uses common filtering engine.
  And its query parameter is common which includes
  "resouce_name"
  and some REST API uses resource_name in URL.

  its code is here
  heat/api/openstack/v1/events.py

Change-Id: Ie7030fb6ba15b6ee7e66fd3f39c03bed1f736782
Closes-Bug: #1500621

subject: Document unsearchable_fields configuration option
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 22:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/plugins.rst'], 'message': "Document unsearchable_fields configuration option

Although RBAC prevents protected fields appearing in search results, it
cannot prevent searching those fields directly. A long term solution is
a separate admin-only index but for now we add a resource plugin option
'unsearchable_fields' which is comma separated and accepts wildcards as
elasticsearch's mapping_template allows. These fields are turned into
index: no, include_in_all: False mapping templates. The value of this
(plus anything coded into a plugin) is also used to redact fields in
_source for non-administrative users.

This patch provides the documentation update for:
 - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/233225/

Change-Id: I94f47515391cf81d72a6a0d09e7a554259a1f8fb
Partial-Bug: #1504399
(cherry picked from commit 0f1518e3d636045350df4a5e8dd8807530691359)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Document unsearchable_fields configuration option

Although RBAC prevents protected fields appearing in search results, it
cannot prevent searching those fields directly. A long term solution is
a separate admin-only index but for now we add a resource plugin option
'unsearchable_fields' which is comma separated and accepts wildcards as
elasticsearch's mapping_template allows. These fields are turned into
index: no, include_in_all: False mapping templates. The value of this
(plus anything coded into a plugin) is also used to redact fields in
_source for non-administrative users.

This patch provides the documentation update for:
 - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/233225/

Change-Id: I94f47515391cf81d72a6a0d09e7a554259a1f8fb
Partial-Bug: #1504399
(cherry picked from commit 0f1518e3d636045350df4a5e8dd8807530691359)

commit_message:
Added checking for invalid or malformed command line parameters

The parse_parameters function needed additional logic to recognize and
reject bad parameters.  Primarily, this fix assures that each
parameter is a valid assignment of the form 'a=b'.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1503515

Change-Id: I79d55359743f9c06fb006292fc61dae273e97eb8

commit_message:
Modify admin_api policy rule

Magnum API's magnum_service:get_all is enforced by admin_api.
Modifying the rule to use context_is_admin. Also changing the to_dict()
call to include change in roles.

Change-Id: I44dda27857945dfd3ad43fa28ea458ce2966388c
Closes-Bug: #1503402

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-11 16:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': "Remove _stop_instances hack in test_volume_boot_pattern

This was a carry over from when the test was originally written in
b3c3cb9c331e9ee54832326420ebe7ac4bf2e080 over 2 years ago.

We shouldn't have to stop the instances in order to delete them, that

commit_message:
Remove _stop_instances hack in test_volume_boot_pattern

This was a carry over from when the test was originally written in
b3c3cb9c331e9ee54832326420ebe7ac4bf2e080 over 2 years ago.

We shouldn't have to stop the instances in order to delete them, that
would be a bug in nova if the delete failed for some reason because the
instances are still active.

Change-Id: I20b7c2e4c2b110933244ba65a1ccdbf246266946

commit_message:
Add a pure cinder_backend to configure PureISCSIDriver

This will allow for setting a few configuration options in local.conf
and remove having to specify so much in explicit Cinder and Nova conf 
sections.

Implements: blueprint pure-cinder-backend
Change-Id: I02d7d0cb75b9dc3e3295be1a5c785af20316f8e2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12403, 'name': 'Al Miller', 'email': 'al.miller@ajmiller.net', 'username': 'ajmiller'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-05 19:49:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Remove root owned ipsec.secrets for ensure_configs

Since LibreSwan requires that ipsec.secrets be owned by root, the
strategy of rewriting the ipsec.secrets file by writing to a temp file
and renaming does not work. This patch removes the target ipsec.secrets
file before running the ensure_configs operations.

NOTE: this is marked work-in-progress because I need to validate whether
or not it is okay to alter (or in this case remove and replace) the
ipsec.secrets file while the ipsec daemon is running.

Change-Id: Id00613e7ca11310e4f65b557b136e02d9783d0d4
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-06 16:00:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove root owned ipsec.secrets for ensure_configs

Since LibreSwan requires that ipsec.secrets be owned by root, the
strategy of rewriting the ipsec.secrets file by writing to a temp file
and renaming causes a permission error and fails to overwrite. This
patch removes the target ipsec.secrets file before running the
ensure_configs operations.

This patch also changes the logging in the _process_running check from
error to info. It isn't an error and will occur under normal
operations.

Change-Id: Id00613e7ca11310e4f65b557b136e02d9783d0d4
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-07 16:03:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/libreswan_ipsec.py'], 'message': "Remove root owned ipsec.secrets for ensure_configs

Since LibreSwan requires that ipsec.secrets be owned by root, the
strategy of rewriting the ipsec.secrets file by writing to a temp file
and renaming causes a permission error and fails to overwrite. This
patch removes the target ipsec.secrets file before running the
ensure_configs operations.

This patch also changes the logging in the _process_running check from
error to info. It isn't an error and will occur under normal
operations.

Change-Id: Id00613e7ca11310e4f65b557b136e02d9783d0d4
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Remove root owned ipsec.secrets for ensure_configs

Since LibreSwan requires that ipsec.secrets be owned by root, the
strategy of rewriting the ipsec.secrets file by writing to a temp file
and renaming causes a permission error and fails to overwrite. This
patch removes the target ipsec.secrets file before running the
ensure_configs operations.

This patch also changes the logging in the _process_running check from
error to info. It isn't an error and will occur under normal
operations.

Change-Id: Id00613e7ca11310e4f65b557b136e02d9783d0d4

[{'created': '2015-10-09 16:26:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Do not log an error when deleting a linuxbridge does not exist

When you're racing to teardown and relying on RPC, it should not be
considered an error that a bridge does not exist when you're trying to
delete it anyway. This is better served as debug level information.

For context, this shows up over 1000 times in successful
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge job runs in a week so it's
probably safe to say it's not contributing to test failures.

Closes-Bug: #1501779

Change-Id: I8e9b27e010d033291497f4e660a97bbae92e75b1
(cherry picked from commit a9dc48f5a4616a505824c3e8520c3dce7436f1b1)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not log an error when deleting a linuxbridge does not exist

When you're racing to teardown and relying on RPC, it should not be
considered an error that a bridge does not exist when you're trying to
delete it anyway. This is better served as debug level information.

For context, this shows up over 1000 times in successful
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge job runs in a week so it's
probably safe to say it's not contributing to test failures.

Closes-Bug: #1501779

Change-Id: I8e9b27e010d033291497f4e660a97bbae92e75b1
(cherry picked from commit a9dc48f5a4616a505824c3e8520c3dce7436f1b1)

[{'created': '2015-10-02 09:45:30.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "Workaround potential failure to shutdown services

Kill them twice to make sure they're good'n'dead. There is a supposed
fix to oslo-incubator code, but we're working around that here in the

Change-Id: I02a7af995dc7de857c4efcf2cef2f95d357c007a

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Workaround potential failure to shutdown services

Kill them twice to make sure they're good'n'dead. There is a supposed
fix to oslo-incubator code, but we're working around that here in the
meantime with this change.

This returned in Liberty.

Change-Id: I02a7af995dc7de857c4efcf2cef2f95d357c007a
Related-Bug: #1446583

subject: Use dictionary literal for dictionary creation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-25 06:50:21.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell_v2.py'], 'message': "Use dictionary literal for dictionary creation

Dictionary creation could be rewritten as a dictionary literal.
for example:

expect_namespace = {}
expect_namespace['namespace'] = 'MyNamespace'
expect_namespace['protected'] = True

could be rewritten as

expect_namespace = {
    'namespace': 'MyNamespace',
    'protected': True
}

commit_message:
Clean up the basic install instructions

Moved everything not related to the delorean repos out of
repositories.txt so that it can be reused for the update page.

Changed refrences to discovery image to ironic-python-agent image.

Fixed missing DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF export. The ironic-python-agent
ramdisk can not build without this.

Change-Id: I054dedd7749eac093b24ac1e3e4f4e47fdb41fe2

commit_message:
Remove usage of WritableLogger from oslo_log

With Eventlet 0.17.2, we can directly pass the logger instance. This
allows us to deprecate/remove the WritableLogger class from oslo.log.

Closes-Bug: #1440773
Change-Id: I3985b30b499a1e676d39c2a6cd3a31ac13c0ab47

commit_message:
Document unsearchable_fields configuration option

Although RBAC prevents protected fields appearing in search results, it
cannot prevent searching those fields directly. A long term solution is
a separate admin-only index but for now we add a resource plugin option
'unsearchable_fields' which is comma separated and accepts wildcards as
elasticsearch's mapping_template allows. These fields are turned into
index: no, include_in_all: False mapping templates. The value of this
(plus anything coded into a plugin) is also used to redact fields in
_source for non-administrative users.

This patch provides the documentation update for:
 - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/233225/

Change-Id: I94f47515391cf81d72a6a0d09e7a554259a1f8fb
Partial-Bug: #1504399

commit_message:
Update IP Version based on Source/Destination IP Address

IP Version in firewall rules was earlier updated only when --ip-version
was explicitly passed to the firewall-rule-create CLI.Now,based on the version
of the IP Address of the passed Source/Destination, the IP Version field in
firewall rules are automatically updated.Default value is used if no address
is passed to the CLI. Source Address is given higher priority.
This reduces the chance of user providing IPv6 address in source/destination
and the CLI showing IP Version as 4.

Closes Bug:#1497066

Change-Id: Iba708db9bd3afb7485ecaf173a67d4acd60b713d

commit_message:
Improve documentation for Liberty release

The documentation cross linking from the devstack rst to the
individual plugins is missing due to the devstack rst living
in a different directory. We just need to provide a bit better
linking from devstack as well as a bit more info on each plugin
for where to place to the configuration options for each plugin.

There is also opportunity to make the documentation between
plugins more consistent and provide release note information.

Change-Id: Ib64eeda8a9f5b59777135537de60f049952a4660
Closes-Bug: #1500647
(cherry picked from commit 7079f81421ae94e7e26816ad6097d9753062ad35)

commit_message:
disable port_security for VRRP ports

For tenant networks port_security makes sense, but for the VRRP router
case it can get in the way. This change disables it for Akanda managed
ports for now.

Change-Id: I0fb9fd5253ad0538a35b25d8806323f83cfc48e4
Closes-bug: #1482389

commit_message:
Don't index admin-only fields

Although RBAC prevents protected fields appearing in search results, it
cannot prevent searching those fields directly. A long term solution is
a separate admin-only index but for now we add a resource plugin option
'unsearchable_fields' which is comma separated and accepts wildcards as
elasticsearch's mapping_template allows. These fields are turned into
index: no, include_in_all: False mapping templates. The value of this
(plus anything coded into a plugin) is also used to redact fields in
_source for non-administrative users.

Documentation update in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ie5bd3fa55ff43fd1a6f52478866261734bd7a051

commit_message:
Cleaned up remaining incorrect usage for LOG.exception

- callers should not explicitly pass exceptions into LOG.exception
  because it's already implicitly included in the message by stdlib
  logging module.
- callers should not call to LOG.exception when there is no exception to
  log about (known to fail in Python 3.x < 3.5).

Change-Id: I58e7e01ed152028ad43bb3ada87d719caa2ab08d
Related-Bug: #1504053

subject: Explicitly install tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 17:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Explicitly install tox

When testing OVN with Kuryr using a setup which only installs Neutron,
keystone, mysql and OVN, the devstack run fails because tox is not
installed. It was being pulled in when installing tempest. Since
networking-ovn uses genconfig to generate a config file, make sure
we install this ourselves.

With this run, my devstack with Kuryr works now.

Change-Id: I67afce78152f250920ef43334e7ee87440bcd075
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Explicitly install tox

When testing OVN with Kuryr using a setup which only installs Neutron,
keystone, mysql and OVN, the devstack run fails because tox is not
installed. It was being pulled in when installing tempest. Since
networking-ovn uses genconfig to generate a config file, make sure
we install this ourselves.

With this run, my devstack with Kuryr works now.

Change-Id: I67afce78152f250920ef43334e7ee87440bcd075
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

subject: Don't index admin-only fields
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 19:08:07.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/functional/test_listener.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_load.py', 'searchlight/tests/functional/test_api.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_nova_server_plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/images.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/servers.py'], 'message': "Don't index admin-only fields

Although RBAC prevents protected fields appearing in search results, it
cannot prevent searching those fields directly. A long term solution is
a separate admin-only index but for now we add a resource plugin option
'unsearchable_fields' which is comma separated and accepts wildcards as
elasticsearch's mapping_template allows. These fields are turned into
index: no, include_in_all: False mapping templates. The value of this
(plus anything coded into a plugin) is also used to redact fields in
_source for non-administrative users.

Documentation update in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ie5bd3fa55ff43fd1a6f52478866261734bd7a051
Closes-Bug: #1504399
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't index admin-only fields

Although RBAC prevents protected fields appearing in search results, it
cannot prevent searching those fields directly. A long term solution is
a separate admin-only index but for now we add a resource plugin option
'unsearchable_fields' which is comma separated and accepts wildcards as
elasticsearch's mapping_template allows. These fields are turned into
index: no, include_in_all: False mapping templates. The value of this
(plus anything coded into a plugin) is also used to redact fields in
_source for non-administrative users.

Documentation update in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Ie5bd3fa55ff43fd1a6f52478866261734bd7a051
Closes-Bug: #1504399

The Ceilometer expirer tool depends on the TTL configuration option to
determine the time-to-live of samples in the Ceilometer database.

here but may require some tweaks to properly integrate with the devtest
setup.  Please see the README-containers.md file for more information
on how to set this up.

bootstrap the image with a container which contains the os-* programs.

commit_message:
Containerized TripleO Overcloud.

This change adds a containerized version of the overcloud compute node for
TripleO.  It's still a work in progress but I figured I'd put it up so people
can comment on how they want to see this advance.  Please see the
README-containers.md file for more information on how to set this up.

This uses AtomicOS as a base operating system and requires that we bootstrap
the image with a container which contains the os-* programs.

Change-Id: I8bbe75abc3f5e160bd4371710cbac236ba8eebc9
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-08 22:17:42.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.

  zuul-cloner or git.

Change-Id: I80dd7e183098d7265ac52da4445c1963dace7ffb

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I80dd7e183098d7265ac52da4445c1963dace7ffb

commit_message:
Make keepalived virtual router IDs configurable

Make the virtual router IDs configurable for the VRRP instances
associated with the Controller VIP or the Public VIP. This allows
side-by-side installations to work, as otherwise, the keepalived
clusters will interfere with each other and ultimately result in
failure to bring up a VIP.

Closes-Bug: 1396695
Co-authored-by: James Polley <jp@jamezpolley.com>
Change-Id: I659c116477d5a99ee6537e0fea80fdee7eaad909

commit_message:
Add metadata and change swift.devices to enable zones

This change adds metadata swift.zones and a corresponding
parameter SwiftZones to set the number of Swift zones to be used
when building the overcloud.  This number defaults to 1.  In
addition we change the swift.devices metadata to include the
server key - of the form controller|SwiftStorage<N> - between %-signs
which is used by the modified element
swift/os-refresh-config/configure.d/73-swift to place the server
in the appropriate zone.

Change-Id: I0e0f5189da1575f2e1ed7fba4bbbe13a8fbf6221

commit_message:
Add Ceilometer configuration ttl setting for expirer

Adds the ttl settings for the Ceilometer expirer tool, defaulting to the
"-1" (retain all) value for the time-to-live for samples in the Ceilometer
database.

Change-Id: I6c7d4cb691c531fd7131e6c09235fe8074063191

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

subject: Add SwiftRingBuild parameter
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 09:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['swift-storage-source.yaml', 'swift-deploy.yaml', 'swift-source.yaml'], 'message': 'Add SwiftRingBuild parameter

We want to add the facility to disable Swift ring building on nodes
running Swift.  To do this we add a parameter called SwiftRingBuild.
If this parameter is set to False or F, then the swift element will
not attempt to build the rings.  If this parameter is set to True
(the default) or T then the swift element will build the rings.

We want to allow an operator to turn off ring-building in the case
where new Swift nodes are being added to an existing Swift cluster.
In the absence of any tooling to help with ring management the
operator will have to use the default method of building new rings
to include the new nodes, and distributing the rings to the Swift
nodes - including existing nodes.

There is a corresponding element change, see
https://review.openstack.org/109029

Change-Id: I01311ec3ca265b151f8740bf7dc57cdf0cf0df6f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add SwiftRingBuild parameter

We want to add the facility to disable Swift ring building on nodes
running Swift.  To do this we add a parameter called SwiftRingBuild.
If this parameter is set to False or F, then the swift element will
not attempt to build the rings.  If this parameter is set to True
(the default) or T then the swift element will build the rings.

We want to allow an operator to turn off ring-building in the case
where new Swift nodes are being added to an existing Swift cluster.
In the absence of any tooling to help with ring management the
operator will have to use the default method of building new rings
to include the new nodes, and distributing the rings to the Swift
nodes - including existing nodes.

There is a corresponding element change, see
https://review.openstack.org/109029

Change-Id: I01311ec3ca265b151f8740bf7dc57cdf0cf0df6f

Add ironic_base test case

  4. Add 1 ironic node
  5. Launch OSTF tests

Partially Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 21:38:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Drop fixtures

Change-Id: Id00869faee250e37b7217357e39bc5fbda567a55
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-08 22:06:51.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Id00869faee250e37b7217357e39bc5fbda567a55
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Id00869faee250e37b7217357e39bc5fbda567a55

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-05 12:59:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Docker compute role configured via Puppet

This change adds a containerized version of the overcloud compute node for
TripleO. Configuration files are generated via OpenStack Puppet modules
which are then used to externally configure kolla containers for
each OpenStack service.

See the README-containers.md file for more information on how to set this up.

This uses AtomicOS as a base operating system and requires that we bootstrap
the image with a container which contains the required os-collect-config agent
hooks to support running puppet, shell scripts, and docker compose.

Change-Id: Ic8331f52b20a041803a9d74cdf0eb81266d4e03c
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Docker compute role configured via Puppet

This change adds a containerized version of the overcloud compute node for
TripleO. Configuration files are generated via OpenStack Puppet modules
which are then used to externally configure kolla containers for
each OpenStack service.

See the README-containers.md file for more information on how to set this up.

This uses AtomicOS as a base operating system and requires that we bootstrap
the image with a container which contains the required os-collect-config agent
hooks to support running puppet, shell scripts, and docker compose.

Change-Id: Ic8331f52b20a041803a9d74cdf0eb81266d4e03c
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Provide minimum VIOS connection on vSCSI volumes

When the admin attempts to connect a volume, they may wish to specify a
minimum level of redundancy (how many Virtual I/O Servers it connects
to).  This change set provides the operator with the ability to set a
minimum number of VIOSes.

Change-Id: Id4d4ca945190f04436792cac12fa08f4412bc114
Closes-Bug: 1504037

commit_message:
Remove openstack_deploy from teardown.sh deletion list

This patch prevents teardown.sh script from deleting
/etc/openstack_deploy in order to let the deployer decide whether to
delete it or not.

Change-Id: I8de55c6fce79bd9301d995c565cfb4e0a38b253a
Closes-Bug: #1504561

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 05:45:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py'], 'message': "Update dhcp host portbinding on failover

When a dhcp server is moved to new host on failover,
tunnel is not created.

When a dhcp server is moved to new host,
1) network-hostagent binding is updated(properly i.e with new host).
2) dhcp port-hostagent binding is not updated
   ( dhcp port is still bound to old host)
If dhcp port-bound agent is different from the new dhcp agent
(which is now taking care of this dhcp port), neutron plugin won't
 notify the l2pop, and hence tunnel is not created.

As after failover, the new agent is taking care of this dhcp port,
update portbinding with the new host. This will allow neutron plugin
to notify l2pop(which will create tunnel).

Change-Id: Ib7d7dcddee005395af116ccd31a43853332ae317
Closes-bug: #1411163
(cherry picked from commit 571453c614577ffd47e23de9a35863d2f2119583)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update dhcp host portbinding on failover

When a dhcp server is moved to new host on failover,
tunnel is not created.

When a dhcp server is moved to new host,
1) network-hostagent binding is updated(properly i.e with new host).
2) dhcp port-hostagent binding is not updated
   ( dhcp port is still bound to old host)
If dhcp port-bound agent is different from the new dhcp agent
(which is now taking care of this dhcp port), neutron plugin won't
 notify the l2pop, and hence tunnel is not created.

As after failover, the new agent is taking care of this dhcp port,
update portbinding with the new host. This will allow neutron plugin
to notify l2pop(which will create tunnel).

Change-Id: Ib7d7dcddee005395af116ccd31a43853332ae317
Closes-bug: #1411163
(cherry picked from commit 571453c614577ffd47e23de9a35863d2f2119583)

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-08 22:08:11.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross

Change-Id: I14b2242c93518793988496386f9eb08aabc3afb4

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I14b2242c93518793988496386f9eb08aabc3afb4

commit_message:
Use LOG.error when no exception handler is used

There's no need to use LOG.exception here since sys.exc_info()
results in (None, None, None) and thus would effectively just
be LOG.error.

Also, the failure of invoking LOG.exception outside of an
exception handler is due to a bug in Python3[1]. The fix for
that is only available in Python3.5.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue17911

Closes-Bug: #1482261

Change-Id: I9ceac0fceafa45769cc15f56027c981182ff0750

commit_message:
Remove unused variables

* Both BIRD and BIRDC are defined but now used everywhere
* METADATA_PROXY is not used everywhere and is pointing to
  the wrong binary. metadata_proxy has been renamed to
  akanda-metadata_proxy.

Change-Id: Ie0888a80df6561cb65c27a2048d75edbe95a3971
Signed-off-by: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Change string generation mechanism for info logging

As stated in Openstack logging and i18n guidelines it is
recommended that formatted string for log messages should be
generated by logger (not by logger client/user). In this case
we can skip formatted message generation if log level configured
not to show info messages.
Also some non-used initialization of logger has been deleted
from the code.

Change-Id: I25660395417ea288aee6a70609a5336e6f74c291

commit_message:
Include scenario test for checking VPN status

1. Validate the VPN-service and ipsec-site connection status
when updating the router status to DOWN and back to ACTIVE state
2. Added methods in vpn_base to support this scenario test
3. Modified test_vpn_connectivity test because of [2]
4. Updated rally_config file to include this scenario test

Change-Id: I72b53b2e01779d57e9ccac0e9c7155d9a8e4e877

The documentation cross linking from the devstack rst to the
individual plugins is missing due to the devstack rst living
in a different directory. We just need to provide a bit better
linking from devstack as well as a bit more info on each plugin
for where to place to the configuration options for each plugin.

commit_message:
Improve documentation for Liberty release

The documentation cross linking from the devstack rst to the
individual plugins is missing due to the devstack rst living
in a different directory. We just need to provide a bit better
linking from devstack as well as a bit more info on each plugin
for where to place to the configuration options for each plugin.

There is also opportunity to make the documentation between
plugins more consistent and provide release note information.

Change-Id: Ib64eeda8a9f5b59777135537de60f049952a4660
Closes-Bug: #1500647

subject: Adds an LBAAS driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-19 00:04:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Start of the LBAAS driver

This is the start of the LBAAS driver.  If you point [lbaas] config
at the existing akanda appliance image, it should spin up a new instance
on and manage the neutron resource's state according to the akanda resource,
tho config update and other driver ops are noops atm.

The port creation currently creates a instance port on the same network as the
LB VIP.  I'm not sure what else we need to do in terms of port plugging.

TODO:
    - Figure out correct port plugging
    - Subscribe to other LBAAS events and translate those into config updates
      (ie, listener or member creation)
    - Figure out how we push config into the instance
        * Use akanda API with added LB support?
        * Talk directly to an nginx+ API within the instance?

This requires a corresponding change to akanda-neutron to enable
the akloadbalancerstatus api extension.

Change-Id: Ic19a883f56fb6d65a83b1f4d93b581f9e242d97f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-22 01:23:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Start of the LBAAS driver

This is the start of the LBAAS driver.  If you point [lbaas] config
at the existing akanda appliance image, it should spin up a new instance
on and manage the neutron resource's state according to the akanda resource.

This LB driver expects to be able to push its config to the akanda-appliance
server running in the image, and that server is responsible for translating
what the RUG gives it to something suitable for the LB service installed in
that image.  There will be a corresponding change to akanda-appliance for this.

The port creation currently creates a instance port on the same network as the
LB VIP.  I'm not sure what else we need to do in terms of port plugging.

List of other things that have been done:

    - Split akanda.rug.api.configuration into akanda-rug.api.config.{common,
      router} in prep for building LBAAS configs as well.
    - Build configuration for both routers and LBs using their own respective
      config libraries, but push to the same appliance via the /v1/system/

TODO:
    - Figure out correct port plugging
    - Subscribe to other LBAAS events and translate those into config updates

This requires a corresponding change to akanda-neutron to enable
the akloadbalancerstatus api extension.

Change-Id: Ic19a883f56fb6d65a83b1f4d93b581f9e242d97f
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-09-22 05:51:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Start of the LBAAS driver

This is the start of the LBAAS driver.  If you point [lbaas] config
at the existing akanda appliance image, it should spin up a new instance
on and manage the neutron resource's state according to the akanda resource.

This LB driver expects to be able to push its config to the akanda-appliance
server running in the image, and that server is responsible for translating
what the RUG gives it to something suitable for the LB service installed in
that image.  There will be a corresponding change to akanda-appliance for this.

The drivers port creation callback currently creates a instance port on the
same network as the LB VIP and auths it as an allowed adddress pair. During
config push to the appliance, we include the VIP port in the configs'
interface map so as to bring up the VIP on the right interface. Note this currently
does not instruct the appliance to bring up the actual address we create for it.

List of other things that have been done:

    - Split akanda.rug.api.configuration into akanda-rug.api.config.{common,
      router} in prep for building LBAAS configs as well.
    - Build configuration for both routers and LBs using their own respective
      config libraries, but push to the same appliance via the /v1/system/

TODO:
    - Figure out correct port plugging
    - Subscribe to other LBAAS events and translate those into config updates

This requires a corresponding change to akanda-neutron to enable
the akloadbalancerstatus api extension.

Change-Id: Ic19a883f56fb6d65a83b1f4d93b581f9e242d97f
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-09-23 01:48:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Start of the LBAAS driver

This is the start of the LBAAS driver.  If you point [lbaas] config
at the existing akanda appliance image, it should spin up a new instance
on and manage the neutron resource's state according to the akanda resource.

This LB driver expects to be able to push its config to the akanda-appliance
server running in the image, and that server is responsible for translating
what the RUG gives it to something suitable for the LB service installed in

The drivers port creation callback currently creates a instance port on the
same network as the LB VIP and auths it as an allowed adddress pair. During
config push to the appliance, we include the VIP port in the configs'
interface map so as to bring up the VIP on the right interface. Note this currently
does not instruct the appliance to bring up the actual address we create for it.

List of other things that have been done:

    - Split akanda.rug.api.configuration into akanda-rug.api.config.{common,
      router} in prep for building LBAAS configs as well.
    - Build configuration for both routers and LBs using their own respective
      config libraries, but push to the same appliance via the /v1/system/
    - Updates most/all neutron objects to have a to_dict() method to make
      it easier to serialize for shipping to the appliance.
    - Wraps instance_manager's configure() with a driver status sync--the LBAAS
      resource needs to be synced everytime we update one of its child resources
      otherwise it waits in PENDING_UPDATE forever.

TODO:
    - Manage neutron status for all child resources (members, listeners, etc)

This requires a corresponding change to akanda-neutron to enable
the akloadbalancerstatus api extension.

Change-Id: Ic19a883f56fb6d65a83b1f4d93b581f9e242d97f

that image.  There will be a corresponding change to akanda-appliance for this.

The drivers port creation callback currently creates a instance port on the
same network as the LB VIP and auths it as an allowed adddress pair. During
config push to the appliance, we include the VIP port in the configs'
interface map so as to bring up the VIP on the right interface. Note this currently
does not instruct the appliance to bring up the actual address we create for it.

List of other things that have been done:

    - Split akanda.rug.api.configuration into akanda-rug.api.config.{common,
      router} in prep for building LBAAS configs as well.
    - Build configuration for both routers and LBs using their own respective
      config libraries, but push to the same appliance via the /v1/system/
    - Updates most/all neutron objects to have a to_dict() method to make
      it easier to serialize for shipping to the appliance.
    - Wraps instance_manager's configure() with a driver status sync--the LBAAS
      resource needs to be synced everytime we update one of its child resources
      otherwise it waits in PENDING_UPDATE forever.

TODO:
    - Manage neutron status for all child resources (members, listeners, etc)

This requires a corresponding change to akanda-neutron to enable
the akloadbalancerstatus api extension.

Change-Id: Ic19a883f56fb6d65a83b1f4d93b581f9e242d97f

commit_message:
Adds an LBAAS driver

This is the start of the LBAAS driver.  If you point [lbaas] config
at the existing akanda appliance image, it should spin up a new instance
on and manage the neutron resource's state according to the akanda resource.

This LB driver expects to be able to push its config to the akanda-appliance
server running in the image, and that server is responsible for translating
what the RUG gives it to something suitable for the LB service installed in
that image.  There will be a corresponding change to akanda-appliance for this.

The drivers port creation callback currently creates a instance port on the
same network as the LB VIP and auths it as an allowed adddress pair. During
config push to the appliance, we include the VIP port in the configs'
interface map so as to bring up the VIP on the right interface. Note this currently
does not instruct the appliance to bring up the actual address we create for it.

This requires a corresponding change to akanda-neutron to enable
the akloadbalancerstatus api extension: http://review.openstack.org/#/c/225370/

And also a change to akanda-appliance: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/226119/

Implements: blueprint lbaas-v2-support

Change-Id: Ic19a883f56fb6d65a83b1f4d93b581f9e242d97f

commit_message:
Added initial homepage using the new dataset service.

This homepage implements a sample layout that uses real example
data, but is still a WIP and has a number of empty stub UI
elements.

Change-Id: Icf5afdfd1d078e250bec29af828ea63f78ee0a9e

The password_config_option_not_marked_secret test checks that
"password" config options have secret=True. The instance of a
password option that's not marked secret is not holding a password
but the entrypoint for the password auth plugin.

commit_message:
Enable password_config_option_not_marked_secret Bandit test

The password_config_option_not_marked_secret test checks that
"password" config options have secret=True. The instance of a
password option that's not marked secret is not holding a password
but the entrypoint for the password auth plugin.

Change-Id: I09355f50269719d173a0bdfc1ea22f8cf9a1cf04

commit_message:
Remove debug output in base image yum command

The base image contains -d 10 in a yum command which prints unhelpful
debug output for one of the yum commands.  Remove the extranous debug
output.

backport: liberty

TrivialFix

This patch is a trivial fix and is a test to set boundaries on what
a trivial fix looks like that doesn't require a bug tracker entry.  If
reviewers feel a trivial fix isn't documented properly by this commit
message, please weigh in, as this is a slight suggested change to our
policy as first institued by the Magnum community and brought to my
attention by Jeff Peeler.  Hopefully this compromise won't be abused :)

Change-Id: I57f00978d0baaefd73592f4ad6a655e663d83478
(cherry picked from commit 8137be87b55e1c9971060d31c85d3a5aa1644b7e)

commit_message:
Install agent dependencies from source for CentOS

Several packages are not installed from RPM packages which are
required in order for CentOS from source to operate correctly.

This looked like sudo was failing to execute, but it was because
the dnsmasq binary was not found.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: If23cfbacd55d9089ffec442399ee0151adea923f
Closes-Bug: #1503412
(cherry picked from commit bc0f8b422ad8a49d59ab2a504a108554cc75cbc0)

commit_message:
Removing /dev/log on rsyslog start

Currently we seem to be experiencing races between containers.
If another containers tries to write to rsyslog before rsyslog container
is up and running it will create /dev/log as directory,
and that will prevent rsyslog from starting.

Change-Id: I88ac27693d12e605f95e3a945fc98783516d7933
Closes-Bug: #1501694
backport: liberty
(cherry picked from commit 7d6621e68bd1be200afc33b9952ce40cb877b793)

commit_message:
Fix up ironic Dockerfiles to build

The dockerfiles for each of these containers were hacked to force
install the most recent version of the package, even though the newer
version had a lower version number. Delorean has fixed the issue by
bumping the epoch, so the hack is no longer required.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: I8d9c071d84e53280d3cadfceb9034bb96f64f3a3
Closes-bug: #1503785
(cherry picked from commit 556597b1116a2e6a7ab6deb3a38a075d6b46dd54)

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 21:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I22ce72a855bc9a2fce396a1d3f109c1f97615d4c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I22ce72a855bc9a2fce396a1d3f109c1f97615d4c

stable enough to call our first Liberty release 1.0.0.

The API consists of the following data:
The locations of config files passed to the container

commit_message:
Release version 1.0.0

Our current version based upon conversations with TTX was
0.1.0. It appears now that the full API is nearly stable.  It is
stable enough to call our first Liberty release 1.0.0.

The API consists of the following data:
The locations of config files passed to the container
The environment variables expected by the container
The JSON encoded file containing the copy and cmd operations

Each container in current master follows the same sytnax and
style for all of the implementations of every container that
atleast has been Ansibilized.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: I2064689ca6fd9f332ad26624e1b93f6aaa08e79b
Closes-Bug: #1503494
(cherry picked from commit 418428a1ad6bd681e9a240689741c49b9111b0d5)

commit_message:
Swift JSON files looking for rings in the wrong place

For Swift, the *.json.j2 templates are looking under
{{ container_config_directory }} whereas they need to be looking in the
common location for swift which is /var/lib/kolla/swift

Change-Id: I6f0dcbc9a705b36d1d98275ba9ebc56404fe882d
backport: liberty
Closes-Bug: #1504210

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 21:43:58.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4f5b3df5c00bca02af401fd458a20aaa07ee560d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4f5b3df5c00bca02af401fd458a20aaa07ee560d

commit_message:
Case insensitiveness when comparing choices values

This path is adding a flag called "ignore_case" for the StrOpt type which
allow case insensitiveness for 'choices' and 'regex' values. The flag
receives a boolean value and if True, the case differences (uppercase
vs. lowercase) between the values of choices will be ignored. It defaults
to False.

This flag is important because it helps with backward compability of a
StrOpt configuration that before accepted case insensitive and now is
using 'choices'

Change-Id: I5f68eee59588dd2be62e11491ad73d452bc9fc07

commit_message:
Code coverage fix and devstack fix

Checkin gates are failing (both coverage and integration/tempest)

Handling the case where testr fails by exiting and returning the
exit status. Newest 'coverage' package does not support 'ignore-errors'
in config section '[report]'.

Also updating devstack plugins/scripts to use updated keystone v3
compatible commands (openstack vs nova)

Change-Id: I06d4e1179f115220608bcb15bbcfccc96769e11e

commit_message:
Enable extend_share in HDFS driver

The extend_share is in Manila core, we can support the new API in
the HDFS drivers. This patch adds methods to the driver along with
its unit tests, and updates related docs.

Implements: blueprint hdfs-native-extend-share

Change-Id: Ia81291eda49dc20c3318f71c51d36682d2aae742
