commit_message:
Update dhcp host portbinding on failover

When a dhcp server is moved to new host on failover,
tunnel is not created.

When a dhcp server is moved to new host,
1) network-hostagent binding is updated(properly i.e with new host).
2) dhcp port-hostagent binding is not updated
   ( dhcp port is still bound to old host)
If dhcp port-bound agent is different from the new dhcp agent
(which is now taking care of this dhcp port), neutron plugin won't
 notify the l2pop, and hence tunnel is not created.

As after failover, the new agent is taking care of this dhcp port,
update portbinding with the new host. This will allow neutron plugin
to notify l2pop(which will create tunnel).

Change-Id: Ib7d7dcddee005395af116ccd31a43853332ae317
Closes-bug: #1411163

commit_message:
Cleanup stale state machine during main worker thread loop

As part of the main worker thread loop, check that we still own
resources associated with the item of work.  If not, skip it and
do some cleanup.

Change-Id: If94fffe3ef3e7cc5da477a03fdfdf07d27770da8

commit_message:
mech_driver: full_sync uses unrelated context for resources

context passed to full sync is unrelated to the resource to be synced.
When necessary, the context needs to be created for the resource

Change-Id: I3d1842c2c0c95bdbaa689727a36c66e210f6273a
Related-Bug: #1371115
Closes-Bug: #1475450
(cherry picked from commit 6537676b899192b7fa96789869adce72ec8f7986)

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2015-03-04 07:09:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Policies based properties protection

To leverage rule based properties protection, "property_protection_file"
and "property_protection_rule_format" should be turned on in `cinder.conf`.

`property-protections-policies.conf` should be presented, typically, drop
this file in `/etc/cinder/` directory, sample configuration files are
provided with the source.

If the rule format is defined as `rule`, the rule defined in
`property-protections-policies.conf` will be parsed and appended with rules
defined in the `policy.json`.

One action(create, read, update, delete) one rule, there is no need define
multi-rules for one action since rules is recursive itself. the rule here
will be checked in the rules defined in `policy.json`, all the same with
oslo.policy verification.

Failed to pass the rule check will throw `ReservedProperty` exception, and
properties modification will fail as well.

Partially implements: bp support-modify-volume-image-metadata

commit_message:
Policies based properties protection

To leverage rule based properties protection, "property_protection_file"
and "property_protection_rule_format" should be turned on in `cinder.conf`.

`property-protections-policies.conf` should be presented, typically, drop
this file in `/etc/cinder/` directory, sample configuration files are
provided with the source.

If the rule format is defined as `rule`, the rule defined in
`property-protections-policies.conf` will be parsed and appended with rules
defined in the `policy.json`.

One action(create, read, update, delete) one rule, there is no need define
multi-rules for one action since rules is recursive itself. The rule here
will be checked in the rules defined in `policy.json`, all the same with
oslo.policy verification.

Failing the rule check will throw `ReservedProperty` exception, and
properties modification will fail as well.

DocImpact: How to enable properties protection need to be documented.
Partially implements: bp support-modify-volume-image-metadata
Change-Id: I80ba460a0981d80e31f0943c77ca4f368a0066df

in `/etc/cinder/` directory, sample configuration files are provided with

the modification of specific property will be compared with rule defined in
the `property-protections.conf`, if one role of user matched with the
permitted role associated with the property, rule check passed the
verification or else exception: ReservedProperty will be thrown out.

commit_message:
Role based properties protection

To leverage role based properties protection, "property_protection_file"
and "property_protection_rule_format" should be turned on in `cinder.conf`.

`property-protections.conf` should be presented, typically, drop this file
in `/etc/cinder/` directory, sample configuration files are provided with
the source.

If the rule format is defined as `role`, the roles of the user who triggers
the modification of specific property will be compared with rule defined in
the `property-protections.conf`, if one role of user matched with the
permitted role associated with the property, rule check passed the
verification or else exception: ReservedProperty will be thrown out.

DocImpact: How to enable properties protection need to be documented.
Partially implements: bp support-modify-volume-image-metadata
Change-Id: I58ed830a4ec080c853f3031a9842eda59bfccafe

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-10 14:31:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Introduce property utils for parsing protection files

This patch bring in the utils used to parse the property protection
files, such as property-protections.conf.

- template file for role based protections
For example, if the file listed as property_protection_file has:
[prop_a]
create = admin,spl_role

then the corresponding rule after parsing is the tuple like this,
(spl_create_prop, {"create": [admin spl_role]})

In the list of user roles, @ means all roles and ! means no role,
! and @ are mutually exclusive.

- template file for policies based protections
For example, if the file listed as property-protections-policies.conf
has:
[prop_a]
create = cinder_creator
then the corresponding policy rule appended to the oslo policies
like this,
"prop_a:create": "rule:cinder_creator"

while cinder_creator is defined in policy.json. For example:
"cinder_creator": "role:admin or role:cinder_create_user"

This patch use role based protections template file as the start,
and policy based part will be given with `Policies based
properties protection`.

Partially implements: bp support-modify-volume-image-metadata

Change-Id: I15dbb7c647c57e04947df8cc35669ee0be9c0a24

commit_message:
Introduce property utils for parsing protection files

This patch bring in the utils used to parse the property protection
files, such as property-protections.conf.

- template file for role based protections
For example, if the file listed as property_protection_file has:
[prop_a]
create = admin,spl_role

then the corresponding rule after parsing is the tuple like this,
(spl_create_prop, {"create": [admin, spl_role]})

In the list of user roles, @ means all roles and ! means no role,
! and @ are mutually exclusive.

- template file for policies based protections
For example, if the file listed as property-protections-policies.conf
has:
[prop_a]
create = cinder_creator
then the corresponding policy rule appended to the oslo policies
like this,
"prop_a:create": "rule:cinder_creator"

while cinder_creator is defined in policy.json. For example:
"cinder_creator": "role:admin or role:cinder_create_user"

This patch use role based protections template file as the start,
and policy based part will be given with `Policies based
properties protection`.

Partially implements: bp support-modify-volume-image-metadata

Change-Id: I15dbb7c647c57e04947df8cc35669ee0be9c0a24

commit_message:
tox.ini: Fix cover by giving the source directory explicitly

By default, testr assumes that the name of distribution
([metadata]name in setup.cfg) matches the name of the source directory.
However, they are different for this project.  Fix the problem by
giving the source directory explicitly via an option provided by pbr.

Closes-Bug: #1502002
Change-Id: I7a4f91d6914f187f6486ec6073d559843ef0f550

commit_message:
Revise node index assignment

This patch reworks the node index assignment logic which previously was
hard-coded upon node creation at db layer. In reality, we cannot
guarantee a NODE_CREATE action created ealier will get the index value
given that actions are executed in concurrently. This patch proposes a
work around so that next_index is preserved when creating a new node.

Change-Id: I0d2f4f26a681886079de82c18077d2db1093602f

commit_message:
Better random resource name generator

This adds a new random name generator that will make it easier to do
out-of-band cleanup of Rally-created resources. It eliminates the
ability for scenarios to specify a custom random name length and
prefix; adds a task-specific portion to the random name; and improves
configurability of random name patterns.

Subsequent commits will implement the new generator.

Implements: blueprint consistent-resource-names
Change-Id: I189474fbb185ab402e3b248421b4188b7ccde7f4

subject: Add references to SG callbacks to avoid GC
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 01:58:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not use object methods for SG callbacks

ML2 mechanism driver for MidoNet is currently used in both the Liberty
and Kilo environment, and must continue to support both cases.

In Kilo, weakref was used for storing callback methods,but that means
that the when the callback class object got garbage collected, all the
registered callback methods got lost.  This problem was fixed in
Liberty with the commit 8959032.

Until we no longer need to support Liberty mech driver working with
Kilo ML2, use module level methods for callbacks instead of object
methods.  Revert this patch when such time arrives.

Change-Id: I71b34b61624fbb40e1338eb6b267744e5d1e85fb
Closes-Bug: #1504373

commit_message:
Add references to SG callbacks to avoid GC

ML2 mechanism driver for MidoNet is currently used in both the Liberty
and Kilo environment, and must continue to support both cases.

In Kilo, weakref was used for storing callback methods where they would
get garbage collected, making all callbacks registered unavailable.
This problem was fixed in Liberty with the commit 8959032.

Until post-Liberty when we no longer need to support the mech driver
compatibility with Kilo ML2, add explicit references to the callback
methods so that they are not garbage collected.

Revert this patch when there is no need to support compatibility with
Kilo ML2.

Change-Id: I71b34b61624fbb40e1338eb6b267744e5d1e85fb
Closes-Bug: #1504373

commit_message:
Changed the way in which attrs were checked

Some memory metrics were failing because of the way
presence of attributes were checked, changed it to
a more explicit way, by using the hasattr(object, attr)
function. This is intended to fix the bug.

Change-Id: I9bf6d211679589608ca5a5bb5fd5b5a0688261ea
Closes-Bug: #1498190

commit_message:
Modified kafka max buffer size

Setting max_buffer_size to None in the kafka consumer object lets the
consumer to grow its internal buffer without limit allowing it to read messages
of any size from the kafka queue.

Change-Id: Ic47068cf1c12a9d40c6d9fe4424cf2d658955139

commit_message:
Libvirt nova: use internalURL endpoint, fix entry

Some environments may block access to the default publicURL
endpoint_type, so switching to internalURL should be more reliable.

Also, the plugin should be using a non-versioned entry point for
novaclient, see https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1493576

Change-Id: I812483294d07a75059ed166d0b2ec4251f7946f2

commit_message:
Block jsonrpclib 0.1.4

Released on 10/8 it doesn't install because README.md isn't
in the MANIFEST.in.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/joshmarshall/jsonrpclib/issues/41

Change-Id: If5720e3fb84b1598b458b6edaa5c706b36fc8b81
Closes-Bug: #1504372

commit_message:
Add a description of "id" response parameter of "Create group" API

Add a description of "id" response parameter for "POST /v3/groups".

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3.html#createGroup.

Change-Id: Ibd82edb9ec034f27c4530bd139ec4dc06e4b9f0a
Closes-Bug: #1502859

subject: tox.ini: Fix cover by giving the source directory explicitly
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-07 06:40:02.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'tox.ini: Fix cover by giving the source directory explicitly

By default, testr assumes that the name of distribution
([metadata]name in setup.cfg) matches the name of the source directory.
However, they are different for this project.  Fix the problem by
giving the source directory explicitly via an option provided by pbr.

Closes-Bug: #1502002
Change-Id: Iaf50fd9cb5a660dd0262211491a4f3afcb4e815c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tox.ini: Fix cover by giving the source directory explicitly

By default, testr assumes that the name of distribution
([metadata]name in setup.cfg) matches the name of the source directory.
However, they are different for this project.  Fix the problem by
giving the source directory explicitly via an option provided by pbr.

Closes-Bug: #1502002
Change-Id: Iaf50fd9cb5a660dd0262211491a4f3afcb4e815c

commit_message:
Add driver framework

This abstracts all router-specific functionality into a router driver,
paving the way for the Rug managing other advanced services.

'rug-ctl router {debug, manage, update, rebuild}' commands have been
deprecated in favor of 'rug-ctl resource' equivalents, to be removed
in M.  The newer 'resource' commands are meant to address any
Rug-managed resource.  These requests are routed to the correct place
on the server-side, instead of a Neutron lookup on the client side.

Co-authored-by: Adam Gandelman <adamg@ubuntu.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint appliance-provisioning-driver
Change-Id: I1d2c68b81d28ebb0ca6ce4dcad237c4803bb96d6

commit_message:
Make deletion policy work for cluster resize action

When deleting nodes from cluster by CLUSTER_RESIZE action,
deletion policy should be triggered if it is attached to the
cluster. This patch adds this.
Also fix a small bug for MIN_SIZE and MAX_SIZE, since they can
be set to '0'.

Change-Id: I8770204b578e990fc0e82a294c1c0af6c5aaee9c

commit_message:
Import _memcache_pool normally

_memcache_pool is imported within a function so that we don't have a hard
dependency on memcache. This is a good idea but _memcache_pool doesn't
have a hard dependency on memcache either so there's no reason to
protect against this here.

Change-Id: I81418fc9fd41e40b9d508ad937d157b2f9ec44c1

commit_message:
Create Environment cache pool

We have three distinct ways that a cache pool can be created, however
only two cache pool classes with the regular _CachePool doubling up.
There's no reason for this and it's harder to read.

Create a very simple _EnvCachePool for the situation where a cache
object was passed down through environment variables.

Change-Id: I86147e887efd6ae302caa12ce996be697d36aa17

commit_message:
Cleanup iSCSI and multipath connections better

This change back-ports a number of bug fixes and design changes that
are in the os-brick library. With these Cinder is much more capable of
correctly removing and cleaning up iSCSI multipath connections.

This is a partial cherry-pick/squash including the following changes in
os-brick’s master branch:

I7a57687cac311c5e53361ccbceb1addb419f1e9f
I59bf37a932acd97cf915d086b4072b71e8214936
I1e5e9eba58a349509e80654ab3058c4ff5d00c0d
I8708db16a4b9057b09abad9f956fa5a3bb4ba54c

Change-Id: I5a23815085edad84725bf544efb2a5ef8e57bb0d
Closes-Bug: #1502534

commit_message:
Add "shared" attribute into Layer3 metering labels

Following APIs are missing "shared" attribute at request/response body.

  * POST /v2.0/metering/metering-labels
      - request/response body
  * GET  /v2.0/metering/metering-labels
      - response body
  * GET  /v2.0/metering/metering-labels/{metering-label-id}
      - response body

Change-Id: I64ef8364eb0af0de6786f63922f445057bc589ca
Closes-bug: 1503493

commit_message:
Add error response codes to create-metering-label

"Create-metering-label" should have the following error response codes:

  * badRequest (400)
  * unauthorized (401)
  * forbidden (403)

Change-Id: I29a29a7aa6c76d2cb92d7f2a9957a17629d4190a
Closes-bug: 1503524

commit_message:
Change remote_ip_prefix as required parameter

When creating metering-label-rule, remote_ip_prefix is required parameter.
However, remote_ip_prefix is set "Optional".

Change-Id: Ie3bb4f721dd19f70d81c582b5469561b269baf2a

commit_message:
Fix response code name with POST metering-label-rule

"BuildinProgress(409)" is wrong error response.
"Conflict(409)" is correct error response.

Change-Id: I29f52b5f25e632f515e825ce38725b4818e1fad6
Closes-bug: 1503690

subject: Custom fixture to avoid external call in HttpCheck
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 19:55:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Custom fixture to avoid external call in HttpCheck

Neutron was mocking urlrequest.urlopen as the original
implementation in oslo.policy was using that inside HttpCheck,
then we switched over to requests.post with change
I364ddb5f86900a3e166f4480d9f4889a68de247f
and a fresh oslo.policy version would have broken them. So
we should have a fixture to enable them to write their
tests without knowing how it is implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1503890
Change-Id: Ia482de71d3db5b89599a1d708a415364cdb468f8

commit_message:
Custom fixture to avoid external call in HttpCheck

Neutron was mocking urlrequest.urlopen as the original
implementation in oslo.policy was using that inside HttpCheck,
then we switched over to requests.post with change
I364ddb5f86900a3e166f4480d9f4889a68de247f
and a fresh oslo.policy version would have broken them. So
we should have a fixture to enable them to write their
tests without knowing how it is implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1503890
Change-Id: Ia482de71d3db5b89599a1d708a415364cdb468f8
